summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting an interview with a witness (likely a victim or associate) conducted on September 1, 2021. The witness provides detailed information about her relationship with Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, describing Maxwell's role in recruiting and grooming, the dynamics between Maxwell and Epstein, and her own experiences of abuse. The document also notes contact from Maxwell's attorneys to the witness and her friends.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of investigation, associate of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described by the witness as charismatic, reaffirming, and deeply involved in recruiting young women for Epstein. She is portrayed as obsessed with Epstein and catering to his demands.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as vulgar, demanding, and having a short attention span. The witness details massaging him and experiencing abuse. Epstein is said to have carried a laminated black book.

persons.name: Lesley
persons.context: Handled scheduling and connected calls between Epstein and the witness. Arranged travel for the witness to Epstein's properties.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as appearing in photographs in Maxwell's apartment, indicating a social connection.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorneys
persons.context: Present during the FBI interview of the witness.

persons.name: Detective
persons.context: Present during the FBI interview of the witness.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Present during the FBI interview of the witness.

connections.description: Described as being in a relationship, with Maxwell deeply obsessed with and catering to Epstein's demands. Maxwell recruited young women for Epstein.
Maxwell groomed and recruited the witness, initially befriending her, then directing her to massage and be with Epstein.
The witness massaged Epstein, during which he touched her. She later had flashbacks and took sleeping pills.
Photographs of Maxwell with Prince Andrew were displayed in Maxwell's apartment.
Lesley was Epstein's secretary, handling his scheduling and travel arrangements.
Maxwell's attorneys contacted the witness's friends, and the witness felt pressure not to speak.

events.title: FBI Interview of Witness
events.description: The witness is interviewed by the FBI, with AUSAs and a detective present. She provides extensive details about her experiences with Maxwell and Epstein.

events.title: Contact from Maxwell's Attorneys
events.description: Maxwell's lawyers contact the witness and her friends in the months leading up to the interview. The witness receives a message saying, 'Friends don't say things to get friends in trouble.'

events.title: Witness's Travel with Epstein/Maxwell
events.description: The witness traveled to New York, Palm Beach, Paris, and Epstein's island to be with Epstein and Maxwell, with arrangements made by Epstein's secretary.

events.title: Initial Grooming and First Massage
events.description: Maxwell befriends the witness, invites her for tea, and later directs her to massage Epstein. The witness is touched by Epstein during a massage.

events.title: Epstein Proposes Having a Child with Witness
events.description: While in Palm Beach, Epstein brings up the subject of having a child with the witness, which angers and humiliates Maxwell.

locations: Nags Head (pub across from Maxwell's London apartment)
keyFacts: The witness states she was 17-18 years old when she first met Ghislaine Maxwell.
Maxwell used schoolgirl-like language ('silly', 'naughty', 'willies') and acted as a recruiter, asking the witness 'who do you know?' to find other young women.
The witness describes massaging Jeffrey Epstein, during which he touched her, leading to later flashbacks and sleep issues.
Maxwell's attorneys contacted the witness and her friends prior to the interview, applying pressure not to cooperate.
The witness describes Maxwell as terrified Epstein would leave her and felt she had to provide young, pretty girls to maintain her position.
